page.title: 02Debenham-Farms @ Drainage.
page.content: The use of larger farm machinery has led to the creation of larger fields,to make the work more convenient and economic.This has resulted in the removal of trees and hedges,to the detriment of wildlife.The consequent filling-in of ditches and pools has necessitated massive expenditure on land drains. Debenham,where four tributary streams feed the river Deben,has always been subject to flooding.The loss of ditches has resulted in more problems after heavy rainfall.These have been alleviated by digging a new,straight channel for the river under Thorpe Lane which enables the water to run away more quickly.In 1983,a water pumping station was built just north of the village.This has helped to maintain a constant flow,to the benefit of aquatic life.
